title: Output Shaft - Assembly

body.body: The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the exploded view (
Lubricate each gear and bush with clean engine oil during assembly.

When using a press, always wear overalls, eye face and hand protection. Objects such as bearings frequently break-up under load and the debris caused during break-up may cause damage and injury to unprotected parts of the body.
Never wear loose clothing, which could become trapped in the press and cause crushing injuries to the hand, arms or other parts of the anatomy.
Bushes and gears with oil holes must always be

with the corresponding oil holes in the output shaft. Reduced oil pressure and gear lubrication may result from alignment of the oil holes, which would cause premature wear of engine and transmission components.

Removing the output shaft bearing from the shaft will damage the bearing and snap ring. Never reuse removed bearings or snap rings as use of damaged or weakened components could lead to engine and transmission damage.
Press only on the bearing inner race to prevent bearing damage.

If removed, working from the output sprocket end of the shaft, fit a new bearing (24) and a new sprocket spacer (25) to the shaft using a press and press bars. Fit the sleeve with the large chamfer facing outwards.
Lubricate and fit a new output shaft seal (26).
If removed, transfer the shaft to the vice and secure between soft jaws. Fit the output sprocket (27), new tab washer (28) and nut (29). Tighten the nut to
Withdraw the shaft from the vice and continue to assemble from the opposite end to the output sprocket.
Fit the plain bush (20) to the shaft.

Locate second gear (21) to the shaft as noted during disassembly, with the large step side facing towards the output sprocket end. Fit the splined thrust washer (19) and retain with a new circlip (18) as shown below.

body.name: Output Shaft Second Gear, Thrust Washer and Circlip (cdmr.svg)

body.body: Fit sixth gear (17) as noted during disassembly, with the selector fork groove facing away from the output sprocket end. Ensure that the oil holes in the gear DO NOT align with the corresponding oil hole in the output shaft.
Fit a new circlip (16) to retain third gear. Fit the splined thrust washer (15) to the rear of third gear as shown below.

body.name: Output Shaft Third Gear, Splined Thrust Washer and Circlip (cdms.svg)

body.body: Fit the splined bush (13) for third gear. Ensure that the oil holes in the gear DO NOT align with the corresponding oil hole in the output shaft. Fit third gear (14) to the shaft with the large step side facing away from the output sprocket.
Fit the splined lock washers (12 and 11), ensuring the tabs in the smaller washer (11) locate in the slots in the larger washer (12) as shown below.

body.name: Output Shaft Third Gear, Large Splined Lock Washer and Small Splined Lock Washer (cdmt.svg)

body.body: Fit the splined bush (10) from fourth gear. Ensure that the oil holes in the gear DO NOT align with the corresponding oil hole in the output shaft.
Fit fourth gear (9) as noted during disassembly, with the larger step side facing towards the output sprocket.
Fit the splined thrust washer (8) and retain with a new circlip (7) as shown below.

body.name: Output Shaft Fourth Gear, Splined Thrust Washer and Crclip (cdmu.svg)

body.body: Fit the fifth gear (6) to the shaft with the groove facing towards the output sprocket. Ensure that the oil holes in the gear DO NOT align with the corresponding oil hole in the output shaft.
Fit the first gear thrust washer (5) and plain bush (4).
Fit first gear (3) to the shaft as marked during disassembly as shown below.

body.name: Output Shaft First Gear, Thrust washers and Needle Roller Bearing (cdmv1.svg)

body.body: Finally fit the thrust washer (2) and needle roller bearing (1) to the end of the shaft.
